description.narrative: Improved national capacity to legislate, monitor and oversee child rights related laws, policies and programmes, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, there is an inclusive and protective legal and policy environment and improved state accountability for the realization of children's rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved national capacity to legislate, monitor and oversee child rights related laws, policies and programmes

description.narrative: Building on progress in strengthening the normative framework on child rights, the foundation has been laid for improved capacity to legislate, monitor and oversee child rights implementation. Key commitments by the highest-level leaders of the National Assembly and the government were made to integrate child-related indicators in the national, sectoral and sub-national SEDS/P for the period 2021-2030, to invest more state budget in children, to strengthen parliamentary oversight on the investment, to legalize the protection of children aged 16 and 17 years and to address violence against children, and to properly implement the national scheme on IECD. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: The UNICEF/Washington Group module on child functioning is used in national censuses and/or surveys

baseline.value: Not used but introduced to the National Statistics Office

target.value: 2018:Used for the first time in the National Survey on People with Disability

actual.value: 2018:The UNICEF/Washington Group module on child functioning was used in the Viet Nam Disability Survey, of which the final report was launched.

title.narrative: Existence of a strengthened system for adolescent participation

actual.value: 2019:Rigorous evidence and data on budgets for children were generated for use in various high-level advocacy events, including the Conference on the Comprehensive Development for children chaired by the Deputy Chairperson of the National Assembly and the 2019 National PFM Forum.

title.narrative: Existence of domestic legislation and administrative guidance in accordance with the Concluding Observations of Committee on the Rights of the Child

baseline.value: There is limited alignment of existing natonal legislations with CRC standards
